articles.title: DPRK FM Meets Foreign Ministers of Various Countries
articles.content:
DPRK FM Meets Foreign Ministers of Various Countries 
						
 Pyongyang, August 7 (KCNA) -- DPRK Foreign Minister Ri Su Yong on August 5 and 6 separately met and had talks with foreign ministers of Russia, Myanmar, Mongolia and Indonesia and the vice-prime minister and concurrently foreign minister of Laos. He took part in the ministerial meeting of the ASEAN Regional Forum held in Malaysia.
					 At the talks, he exchanged with them views on series of issues of mutual concern including the development of friendly relations between the DPRK and those countries.
					
					 Ri Su Yong separately met the advisor to the prime minister of Pakistan on National Security and Foreign Affairs and the minister of State for Foreign Affairs of India.

articles.title: Lao Delegation Leaves
articles.content:
Lao Delegation Leaves
 Pyongyang, August 7 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Lao Department of Civil Aviation led by Director Lopangkao Yakva left here for home on Friday.

articles.title: Greetings to C.C., Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
articles.content:
Greetings to C.C., Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
						
 Pyongyang, August 7 (KCNA) -- The Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea Friday sent a message of greeting to the Central Committee of the Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front on the occasion of the 52nd anniversary of its founding.
					 The message sincerely wished the front bigger success in its activities to strengthen it and achieve the prosperity of the country, expressing the belief that the good friendly and cooperative relations between the two parties would grow stronger in the interests of the peoples of the two countries.

articles.title: Media Persons Tour Revolutionary Battle Sites in Mt. Paektu Area
articles.content:
Media Persons Tour Revolutionary Battle Sites in Mt. Paektu Area
						
 Samjiyon, August 7 (KCNA) -- Media persons made a study tour of revolutionary battle sites in the area of Mt. Paektu from August 1 to 7.
					 They laid bouquets before the statues of President Kim Il Sung at the Monument to the Victorious Battle of Pochonbo, the Pochonbo Revolutionary Battle Site, Chongbong Bivouac, the shore of Lake Samji and the Monument to the Victorious Battle in Musan Area and the mosaic depicting the three commanders of Mt. Paektu in the secret camp on Mt. Paektu and paid tribute to them.
					
					 At the Pochonbo Revolutionary Battle Site they looked round the command post of the battle, the police post of the Japanese imperialists and the subcounty office.
					
					 They also toured the Spring Site in Poso-ri, the monument to proposition in the tableland of Junghung and the Rimyongsu Revolutionary Site associated with revolutionary feats of leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Seeing the trees bearing slogans at Chongbong, Konchang and Pegaebong bivouacs, they enshrined the faith of sure victory displayed by the anti-Japanese revolutionary forerunners who fought for the country and nation in a do-or-die spirit.
					
					 After arriving at Lake Samji, they looked round groups of sculptures of the Samjiyon Grand Monument, deeply grasping the boundless reverence of the anti-Japanese guerrillas and people for Kim Il Sung and their indomitable fighting spirit and ardent patriotism.
					
					 After marching along the Kapsan-Musan guard road, they visited the Monument to the Victorious Battle in Musan Area. They climbed Mt. Paektu.
					
					 At Kim Jong Il's birthplace in the Paektusan Secret Camp, they went round historic relics preserved with much care at his old home, being briefed on the fact that he was born into the Shining Star of Mt. Paektu and grew up, hearing gunfire of the anti-Japanese war as a lullaby.
					
					 During the study tour they had meetings to hear impressions of the reminiscences of anti-Japanese guerrillas read by them, poem-reciting meetings and conducted sports games and other colorful political and cultural work.

articles.title: Foreign Diplomatic Envoys and Military Attaches Here Visit Area of Mt. Paektu
articles.content:
Foreign Diplomatic Envoys and Military Attaches Here Visit Area of Mt. Paektu
						
 Samjiyon, August 7 (KCNA) -- Foreign diplomatic envoys and members of the military attaches corps here visited the area of Mt. Paektu from Aug. 5 to 7 on the occasion of the 70th anniversary of Korea's liberation.
					 They laid a floral basket before the statue of President Kim Il Sung standing on the shore of lake Samji and paid tribute to him.
					
					 Being briefed on the Samjiyon Grand Monument, they looked round groups of sculptures depicting indomitable anti-Japanese revolutionary forerunners who devoted their youth and lives to the country's liberation.
					
					 They visited Kim Jong Il's birthplace in the Paektusan Secret Camp. Being briefed on the immortal revolutionary life and feats of Kim Jong Il, they looked round historic relics preserved with much care.
					
					 They climbed Mt. Paektu. 
					
					 They also visited the Monument to the Victorious Battle in Musan Area, Sinsadong Revolutionary Battle Site, Paektu Museum, etc.

articles.title: Athletes and Coaches Awarded Distinctions
articles.content:
Athletes and Coaches Awarded Distinctions 
 Pyongyang, August 7 (KCNA) -- The title of People's Athlete was awarded to Kim Kuk Hyang and Sin Jong Rim and the title of Merited Athlete to Kim Un Hyang, Song Nam Hyang, Mun Ran Ok and Jong Hye Sun, swimmers who proved successful at the 16th FINA World Championships, and their coaches.
					 The Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK published a relevant decree on Thursday.

articles.title: World Diving Champion Welcomed upon Her Return Home
articles.content:
World Diving Champion Welcomed upon Her Return Home
						
 Pyongyang, August 7 (KCNA) -- DPRK player Kim Kuk Hyang returned home on Friday. She placed first at the diving women's 10m platform finals of the 16th FINA World Championships held in Kazan, Russia.
					 Kim and other players and coaches were greeted at Pyongyang International Airport by Kim Yong Jin, vice-premier of the Cabinet, Ri Il Hwan, department director of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, Kim Yong Hun, minister of Physical Culture and Sports, and officials concerned. 
					
					 Sportspersons, people, youths and students, family members put garlands around their necks, congratulating them on their successes.
					
					 When the bus carrying them passed the midtown streets, Pyongyangites waved to them, congratulating them on their successes.
					
					 They laid bouquets before the statues of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il on Mansu Hill before paying tribute to them.
					
					 On the same day Kim was interviewed by media persons here at Kim Il Sung Stadium.
					
					 She said she could bag a gold medal for the first time in the world championships as she applied the superb sporting method of Korean style in each contest, true to the noble intention of Marshal Kim Jong Un. 
					
					 She pledged to prepare herself as an ideologically and mentally and physically and technically strong player through intensive training and thus make a positive contribution to demonstrating the heroic spirit of Kim Il Sung's nation and Kim Jong Il's Korea with gold medals in the future, too.

articles.title: Pyongyangites Welcome DPRK's First World Diving Champion
articles.content:
Pyongyangites Welcome DPRK's First World Diving Champion
						
 Pyongyang, August 7 (KCNA) -- Kim Kuk Hyang of the DPRK returned home on Friday after taking the diving women's 10m platform title at the 16th FINA World Championships.
					 People in the capital city of Pyongyang turned out in streets to give warm welcome to the country's first world swimming champion.
					
					 Kwon In Guk, a coach of the Jangsan Sports Team, told KCNA:
					
					 All the people in the country are delighted at Kim's success. It is another big stride toward the building of a sports powerhouse.
					
					 I will do my best to train my players to be world champions in skating and my players, too, are filled with determination to glorify the country with gold medals.
					
					 Choe Hyang Mi, an official of the Pyongyang Cornstarch Factory, said:
					
					 I'd love to extend my heartfelt congratulations to Kim Kuk Hyang again.
					
					 Her success evidently shows the validity and vitality of the Workers' Party of Korea's idea of attaching importance to sports.
					
					 I hope that my country's swimmers would win more gold medals in international tournaments.
					
					 Yu Jong Chol, a teacher of Kim Il Sung University, said that Kim's success gave strength and courage to him and his fellows in the education of rising generation and the scientific researches.

articles.title: Pyongyang Home for Aged Inaugurated
articles.content:
Pyongyang Home for Aged Inaugurated 
 Pyongyang, August 7 (KCNA) -- The Pyongyang Home for the Aged has been successfully built on the bank of the River Taedong in the wake of the Pyongyang Baby Home and Orphanage.
					 It has the best amenities for the health and living of the aged such as bedrooms, dining rooms, library, exercise rooms and treatment wards.
					
					 A ceremony of its completion took place on Friday.
					
					 Present there were O Su Yong, secretary of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK), Kim Yong Jin, vice-premier, Jong Yong Su, minister of Labor who doubles as chairman of the Central Committee of the Federation for the Care of the Elderly of Korea, Kim Su Gil, chief secretary of the Pyongyang City Committee of the WPK, Cha Hui Rim, chairman of the Pyongyang City People's Committee, commanding officers and soldier-builders of the unit of the Korean People's Army which took part in its construction, officials of the home and its health-seekers and employees, officials of party and power bodies and those of relevant units in the city.
					
					 O Su Yong, addressing the ceremony, said that the Pyongyang Home for the Aged is the edifice provided by the WPK with love for the people, true to the noble intention of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 There are many countries and aged people in the world, but it is only the DPRK led by the peerlessly great men which built such palace-like home for the aged, he noted.
					
					 Representatives of health-seekers cut the inaugural tape.
					
					 Officials concerned and officials and employees of the home congratulated the health-seekers moving to the new home.

articles.title: National Scientific and Technological Presentation in Field of Footwear Industry Held
articles.content:
National Scientific and Technological Presentation in Field of Footwear Industry Held
						
 Hyesan, August 7 (KCNA) -- A national scientific and technological presentation in the field of footwear industry was held in Hyesan, Ryanggang Province from August 5 to 7 under the sponsorship of the Central Committee of the General Federation of Science and Technology of Korea.
					 Present there were scientists and technicians in the field of footwear industry.
					
					 The participants heard valuable papers presented by the Technical Preparation Center of the Management Bureau for the Shoe-making Industry, the Wonsan Shoes Factory, the Sinuiju Shoes Factory and various other units.
					
					 Introduced there were successes and experience gained in improving the quality of shoes, true to the intention of the Party to increase the varieties of shoes and put their production on a diverse and multi-color basis and updating production processes.
					
					 A series of papers were highly appreciated.
					
					 The presentation also involved a lecture on the latest trend in the development of footwear industry and scientific and technological issues of raising the quality of shoes and their competitiveness and increasing the proportion of locally available raw and other materials and equipment.

articles.title: Golden Plate Scriptures, Historical Relics of Korea
articles.content:
Golden Plate Scriptures, Historical Relics of Korea
						
 Pyongyang, August 7 (KCNA) -- Golden plate scriptures were recently displayed at the Korean Central History Museum in the DPRK.
					 They comprise two sets; one showing scripture by pictures and the other showing scripture by letters.
					
					 The picture scripture consists of 20 gilded silver sheets, each 12.8×9 cm in size, and the letter scripture of 16 gilded bronze sheets, each 11×12 cm.
					
					 The pictures and letters were inscribed by way of spinning, and the form of a character is a square style.
					
					 The scriptures, made in the early period of Koryo Dynasty (918-1392), are of high value in academic and manufacturing aspects.
					
					 The newly displayed scriptures are listed as a national treasure as they show the then advanced metal workmanship and typography.

articles.title: DPRK Strives to Use Natural Energies
articles.content:
DPRK Strives to Use Natural Energies
						
 Pyongyang, August 7 (KCNA) -- A brisk campaign has been conducted in the DPRK to develop wind, geothermal, solar and other natural energies.
					 In March when he toured Kumsanpho pickled-fish processing factory and fishery station under construction, supreme leader Kim Jong Un called for directing big efforts to solving the issue of electricity for production and living. And he stressed the need to build a wind and solar power station on Nunggum Islet.
					
					 True to his intention, officials and working people across the country turned out in a drive to meet the growing demand for power by use of natural energies.
					
					 A group of researchers of Kim Chaek University of Technology recently helped set up several wind generators in the Sepho area stockbreeding base.
					
					 Meanwhile, members of the February 17 Shock Brigade of Scientists and Technicians installed wind-driven water pumps with a large capacity in different parts of the stockbreeding base.
					
					 Wind and solar generators were installed at the Jangchon Vegetable Co-op Farm in Sadong District, Pyongyang.
					
					 In Rason City of the country, solar street lamps have appeared in ten major streets in recent five years.
					
					 The Ministry of State Natural Resources Development invented a new method for ensuring the geothermal cooling-and-heating system on a normal basis while preventing land subsidence.
					
					 This geothermal cooling-and-heating system was introduced to many units.

articles.title: Tennis Encouraged in DPRK
articles.content:
Tennis Encouraged in DPRK
						
 Pyongyang, August 7 (KCNA) -- Tennis is encouraged as one of the popular sports events in the Democratic People's Republic of Korea.
					 Koreans have long enjoyed playing tennis and worked hard for its development.
					
					 According to historical records, playing this event in Korea began at the end of the 19th century. Tennis was for physical exercise at the beginning and then developed into a sports event in the country, which was popular among youth and students and women.
					
					 In the 20th century there appeared a Korean Tennis Association (May 1922), even under the harsh colonial rule by the Japanese imperialists, and various tennis games took place in the country.
					
					 In particular, the all-Korea women tennis tournament was held in 1923 for the first time and it had since continued till 1939 for 17 times. This showed the deep interest of Korean women in tennis.
					
					 At that time the Korean tennis players displayed the stamina and wisdom of the nation by defeating their Japanese rivals in every tournament.
					
					 Today the tennis technique develops rapidly in the DPRK thanks to its government's policy of encouraging it.
					
					 Tennis courts have been provided in various gymnasiums and stadiums and sports parks in Pyongyang and many other parts of the country.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Raps at U.S. Gibberish about Dialogue
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Raps at U.S. Gibberish about Dialogue
Pyongyang, August 7 (KCNA) -- The U.S. gibberish about dialogue for the denuclearization on the Korean peninsula is nothing but a cunning trick to get rid of the responsibility for the deteriorated situation on the peninsula. Rodong Sinmun Friday says this in an article.
					The paper goes on:
					
					Times have changed, but the only peninsula suffers from a tragedy of territorial partition and national split and it is under the constant military tension and danger of war.
					
					This is directly related with the U.S. brigandish hostile policy towards the DPRK.
					
					Though the owners of the White House have been replaced from the Truman administration responsible for Korea's division to the present Obama administration, the U.S. hostile policy towards the DPRK has never changed, but gets further supplemented with more vicious contents.
					
					The sanctions, isolation and blockade and undisguised military threats which the U.S. is kicking off aiming at the DPRK's nuclear deterrent for self-defense push the situation on the peninsula to the brink of war. The U.S. overrules justice with injustice and covers truth with lies and this shameless political fraud goes beyond the danger line.
					
					The DPRK has made every possible effort to denuclearize the peninsula.
					
					However, the U.S. shunned the DPRK's efforts and resorted to the frantic nuclear threat and blackmail.
					
					The DPRK's nuclear deterrent is neither a trade means nor a bargaining chip for dialogue and improved relations.
					
					No progress can be made in the DPRK-U.S. relations as long as the U.S. harbors the inveterate bitterness and hostile policy towards the DPRK.

articles.title: Public Anger at Chief Executive Runs High in S. Korea
articles.content:
Public Anger at Chief Executive Runs High in S. Korea
						
 Pyongyang, August 7 (KCNA) -- Public anger at the chief executive is running high in south Korea.
					 The result of the opinion poll conducted by Seoul Economic Daily on Aug. 2 said that grievance against the chief executive in south Korean Kangwon Province and on Jeju Island this year was stronger than last year. 
					
					 Such tendency is noticeable among the conservative forces that have supported the chief executive.
					
					 People aged 60 and above known to be a typical generation advocating conservatism turned their backs on Park Geun Hye.
					
					 Voices critical of her grew stronger in Pusan and South Kyongsang Province regarded as a support base for the conservative forces.
					
					 The south Korean puppet regime should properly understand the public mindset and deeply repent of all its wrongdoings.

articles.title: S. Korean Civic Organizations Oppose Building of Jeju Naval Base
articles.content:
S. Korean Civic Organizations Oppose Building of Jeju Naval Base
						
 Pyongyang, August 7 (KCNA) -- Civic and public organizations of south Korea including the Kangjong Village Society, the All-People Measure Committee for Checking Jeju Military Base and Making Jeju Island Peaceful Island and the Measure Committee for Checking Building of Jeju Naval Base issued a joint statement on Aug. 3.
					 The statement recalled that 3 000 days have passed since inhabitants in Kangjong village, Sogwipho City, Jeju Province started the action in protest against the building of Jeju naval base.
					
					 It denounced the regime for making desperate efforts to pass the buck for the procrastination of the project to the inhabitants in Kangjong village.
					
					 The Jeju naval base construction is quite contrary to peace in Kangjong village, the statement noted, adding that they would carry on their action to turn Jeju Island into a peaceful island.

articles.title: Anniversary of Korean Youth League in Japan Marked
articles.content:
Anniversary of Korean Youth League in Japan Marked
						
 Tokyo, August 6 (KNS-KCNA) -- A meeting was held at Korean University in Tokyo, Japan on Aug. 2 to observe the 60th anniversary of the formation of the Korean Youth League in Japan.
					 Present there were Nam Sung U, vice-chairman of the Central Standing Committee of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan, Kim Yong Ju, chairman of the C.C., the Korean Youth League in Japan, officials and members of the youth league.
					
					 Introduced at the meeting were a message sent by the C.C., the Kim Il Sung Socialist Youth League and other messages from the homeland.
					
					 Nam Sung U in a congratulatory speech said that it is an honorable patriotic duty of the Korean youth and students in Japan to creditably perform the mission they assumed before the era and the nation, sharing the same breath and footsteps with the young people in the homeland all out in a heroic struggle to win the final victory under the leadership of Marshal Kim Jong Un who has pursued the politics of love and trust for the young people.
					
					 Kim Yong Ju noted in a report that the formation of the youth league was a historic event that opened a new phase of the overseas youth movement in the world and brought about a fundamental turn in the development of the Korean youth movement in Japan and the life of Korean youth and students in Japan. 
					
					 He declared that the Korean youth in Japan would demonstrate the new spirit and fresh appearance of the youth league in Japan advancing full of dynamism.
					
					 At the end of the meeting, there took place an art performance and joint meeting.
					
					 Meanwhile, a photo exhibition was held to mark the anniversary of the youth league in Japan on the same day.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un's Congratulatory Speech Introduced in UK
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un's Congratulatory Speech Introduced in UK
						
 Pyongyang, August 7 (KCNA) -- The British Association for the Study of Songun Policy on August 1 posted on its website the full text of the congratulatory speech made by supreme leader Kim Jong Un at the 4th National Conference of War Veterans.
					 The website carried his photo.

articles.title: Seminar Held in Uganda to Mark Anniversary of Korea's Liberation
articles.content:
Seminar Held in Uganda to Mark Anniversary of Korea's Liberation
						
 Pyongyang, August 7 (KCNA) -- An Ugandan national seminar on the theme of "DPRK's experience in Songun politics" took place in Kampala on July 31 on the occasion of the 70th anniversary of Korea's liberation.
					 Present there were Kirunda Kivejinja, senior adviser to the Ugandan president and member of the Executive Committee of the Uganda National Resistance Movement, the chairman of the Ugandan National Executive Committee of the Pan-African Movement, Mayambala Lawrence, chairman of the Ugandan National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea, the chairman of the Group for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism in Makerere University, and followers of the Juche idea.
					
					 Present there on invitation were the ambassador and staff members of the DPRK embassy in Kampala.
					
					 Kirunda Kivejinja and others praised President Kim Il Sung for embarking upon the road of revolution in his teens, clarifying the principle of Songun based on the Juche idea out of his immutable will to counter with arms the Japanese imperialists armed from head to foot, founding the Korean People's Revolutionary Army and liberating Korea by leading the hard-fought anti-Japanese war to a victory.
					
					 The President, despite difficult conditions in the wake of Korea's liberation, strengthened the revolutionary forces and thus defended the sovereignty of the young DPRK from the U.S. invasion, they said, adding:
					
					 The Songun idea of the President was applied to HE Kim Jong Il's Songun leadership. Kim Jong Il with his unprecedented Songun politics developed the DPRK into a political and ideological power, nuclear power and satellite manufacturer and launcher.
					
					 A letter to Marshal Kim Jong Un was adopted at the seminar.

articles.title: DPRK Praised by Russia, Brazil
articles.content:
DPRK Praised by Russia, Brazil
 Pyongyang, August 7 (KCNA) -- A Russian political party and Brazilian bodies posted articles on their websites on the occasion of the 62nd anniversary of the victory of the Korean people in the great Fatherland Liberation War.
					 The All-Union Communist Party of Bolsheviks cited numerical facts to expose the big losses the U.S. faced in the war in an article titled "DPRK celebrating July 27, the day of victory in Fatherland Liberation War".
					
					 It went on: The Korean people inflicted serious defeats on the U.S. unprecedented in history.
					
					 The U.S. is persistently maneuvering to bring the people of socialist Korea into submission.
					
					 The DPRK could not but have access to its own nuclear weapons in the tense situation of neither war nor peace.
					
					 The nuclear weapons of the DPRK have become a means for repulsing aggression from outside.
					
					 The Brazilian Committee for Solidarity with the DPRK said that the July 27, 1953 was recorded as the day of victory that glorified the dignity and honor of the country in the history of the struggle of the Korean people but for the U.S. it was recorded as a tragic day when it suffered the bitterest defeat in its history.
					
					 The Brazilian Center for the Study of the Juche Idea in articles detailed the great contributions the Korean women made to winning the victory in the Fatherland Liberation War by displaying the heroic spirit of self-sacrifice and patriotic devotion.

articles.title: Brazilian Organization Reveals Cruelty of U.S. Biochemical Warfare
articles.content:
Brazilian Organization Reveals Cruelty of U.S. Biochemical Warfare 
						
 Pyongyang, August 7 (KCNA) -- The Brazilian Center for the Study of the Juche Idea on July 28 posted on its website an article titled "U.S. brutal biochemical warfare" disclosing the U.S. murdering the innocent Korean people with chemical weapons as well as germ weapons during the Fatherland Liberation War.
					 The U.S. controversial introduction of anthrax germs into south Korea in recent days remind people of the U.S. biochemical warfare in the past Korean war, the article said, and went on:
					
					 The U.S. openly used germ weapons, poisonous gas, poisonous chemical weapons and other poisonous materials for massacring the Koreans in the Korean war.
					
					 During the war, the fact-finding groups of the Women's International Democratic Federation, the International Association of Democratic Lawyers and international progressive scientists made a field survey of the affected areas in the DPRK and roundly exposed the U.S. cruel biochemical warfare.
					
					 The U.S., which once sought to occupy the whole of Korea by exterminating the Korean nation through the deliberate and intentional biochemical warfare in the Korean war, behaved shamelessly to divert elsewhere criticism of its anthrax germ introduction into the DPRK.
					
					 The servicepersons and people of the DPRK will always remember the evil history of the U.S. imperialist murderers and force them to pay for their crimes.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il, Kim Jong Un Praised by Russian Paper
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il, Kim Jong Un Praised by Russian Paper
						
 Pyongyang, August 7 (KCNA) -- The Russian paper Tsumenskaya Pravda on July 23 devoted one whole page to articles titled "History of friendship".
					 The paper carried photos dealing with President Kim Il Sung's historical visit to the Soviet Union, photos of leader Kim Jong Il having talks with President Putin and former President Medvedev and photos of Marshal Kim Jong Un meeting the head of the Orchestra of the 21st Century of Russia and his party during their visit to the DPRK.
					
					 The paper also carried an article praising Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il and Kim Jong Un for working heart and soul for the development of the friendly relations between the DPRK and the Soviet Union and between the DPRK and Russia.

articles.title: Pyongyang Time Fixed in DPRK
articles.content:
Pyongyang Time Newly Fixed in DPRK 
						
 Pyongyang, August 7 (KCNA) -- The DPRK decided to fix a new standard time on the occasion of the 70th anniversary of Korea's liberation.
					 A relevant decree promulgated by the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK on Wednesday noted as follows:
					
					 It was on August 15 when President Kim Il Sung, benefactor of national resurrection and peerless patriot, crushed the brigandish Japanese imperialists by making long journeys of anti-Japanese bloody battles and liberated Korea. It was the day of historical significance as it put an end to the history of national sufferings and brought about a radical turn in carving out the destiny of the country and its people.
					
					 The wicked Japanese imperialists committed such unpardonable crimes as depriving Korea of even its standard time while mercilessly trampling down its land with 5 000 year-long history and culture and pursuing the unheard-of policy of obliterating the Korean nation.
					
					 It is the firm faith and will of the DPRK's service personnel and people to force the Japanese imperialists to pay for the monstrous crimes committed by them for a century, firmly defend the national sovereignty and demonstrate for eternity the dignity and might of the great Paektusan nation shining with the immortal august names of Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK made the following decision reflecting the unshakable faith and will of the service personnel and people on the 70th anniversary of Korea's liberation:
					
					 Firstly, the time at 127 degrees 30 minutes east longitude or 30 minutes later than the present one shall be fixed as the standard time of the DPRK and called Pyongyang time. 
					
					 Secondly, Pyongyang time shall be applied from Aug. 15, Juche 104 (2015).
					
					 Thirdly, the DPRK Cabinet and relevant organs shall take practical steps to carry out this decree.

articles.title: Ri Su Yong se reune con cancilleres de varios paises
articles.content:
Ri Su Yong se reune con cancilleres de varios paises 
						
Pyongyang, 7 de agosto (ACNC) -- El ministro de Relaciones Exteriores de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Ri Su Yong, quien esta de visita en Malasia para participar en la reunion ministerial del Foro de la Asociacion de Naciones del Sudeste Asiatico (ASEAN), departio los dias 5 y 6 por separado con sus homologos de Rusia, Myanmar, Mongolia e Indonesia y con el vicepremier y canciller de Laos. 
					En las ocasiones se intercambiaron las opiniones sobre el desarrollo de las relaciones de amistad entre los paises y una serie de los asuntos de interes mutuo. 
					
					Ri Su Yong departio tambien con el asesor del premier para la seguridad nacional y relaciones exteriores de Pakistan y el ministro de Estado para las Relaciones Exteriores de la India.

articles.title: Representantes diplomaticos y agregados militares en RPDC visitan zona de Paektu
articles.content:
Representantes diplomaticos y agregados militares en RPDC visitan zona de Paektu
						
Samjiyon, 7 de agosto (ACNC) -- Con motivo del aniversario 70 de la liberacion de Corea, los representantes diplomaticos y los miembros del Cuerpo de Agregados Militares de varios paises en Corea recorrieron del dia 5 al 7 la zona del monte Paektu.
					Los huespedes rindieron tributo al Generalisimo Kim Il Sung, depositando un cesto de flores ante su estatua de bronce levantada a la orilla del lago Samji.
					
					Acto seguido, escucharon las explicaciones sobre el Conjunto Monumental de Samjiyon y pasaron revista a los grupos escultoricos que reflejan el indoblegable aspecto de lucha y el ardiente patriotismo de los martires revolucionarios antijaponeses, quienes dedicaron su juventud y vida por la liberacion de la patria.
					
					En la casa natal del Generalisimo Kim Jong Il, enclavada en el Campamento Secreto del Monte Paektu, pasaron revista a los objetos historicos escuchando las explicaciones sobre la vida revolucionaria y las proezas del Generalisimo.
					
					Los huespedes subieron al monte Paektu.
					
					Ademas, visitaron el Obelisco a la Victoria en la Batalla de la Zona de Musan, el Lugar de Batalla Revolucionaria de Sinsadong, el Museo Paektu, etc.

articles.title: Campeona Kim Kuk Hyang en Pyongyang
articles.content:
Campeona Kim Kuk Hyang en Pyongyang
						
Pyongyang, 7 de agosto (ACNC) -- Regreso este viernes la nadadora Kim Kuk Hyang tras ocupar el primer lugar en el salto de la plataforma fija de 10m (f) del XVI Campeonato Mundial de la Federacion Internacional de Natacion que tuvo lugar en Kazan de Rusia.
					El vicepremier Kim Yong Jin, el jefe de departamento del Comite Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Ri Il Hwan, el ministro de Deportes Kim Yong Hun y otros funcionarios interesados acogieron en el Aeropuerto Internacional de Pyongyang a Kim Kuk Hyang y otros jugadores y entrenadores. 
					
					A la campeona en autobus los ciudadanos le felicitaron agitando las manos. 
					
					Los jugadores y entrenadores rindieron homenaje a los grandes lideres Kim Il Sung y Kim Jong Il tras colocar ramos de flores ante sus estatuas de bronce en la colina Mansu. 
					
					Este dia, la ganadora concedio una conferencia de prensa en el Estadio Kim Il Sung con la participacion de los periodistas de esta capital. 
					
					En la ocasion Kim Kuk Hayng dijo que pudo ganar por primera vez la medalla de oro en la competencia mundial por haber aplicado los metodos al estilo coreano en las competencias en acato al noble proposito del Mariscal Kim Jong Un. 
					
					Expuso la decision de prepararse mas en lo ideo-espiritual y en lo fisico y tecnico e intensificar los ejercicios para contribuir a exaltar con las medallas de oro el impetu heroico de la nacion de Kim Il Sung y Corea de Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Tiene lugar ceremonia de inauguracion de Asilo de Ancianos de Pyongyang
articles.content:
Tiene lugar ceremonia de inauguracion de Asilo de Ancianos de Pyongyang
						
Pyongyang, 7 de agosto (ACNC) -- Se ha levantado excelentemente a la orilla del rio Taedong el Asilo de Ancianos de Pyongyang junto al Hospicio y Orfanato de Pyongyang. 
					　En el Asilo de Ancianos de Pyongyang estan acondicionados en el maximo nivel el dormitorio, el comedor, la biblioteca, la sala de ejercicios fisicos, la de tratamiento medico y otras condiciones y ambientes necesarios a la salud y la vida de los ancianos. 
					
					Tuvo lugar el dia 7 la ceremonia de inauguracion con la participacion del secretario del Comite Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, O Su Yong, el vicepremier Kim Yong Jin, el ministro del Trabajo y presidente del Comite Central de la Federacion de Proteccion de los Ancianos de Corea, Jong Yong Su, el secretario jefe del Comite del PTC en la Ciudad de Pyongyang, Kim Su Gil, el presidente del Comite Popular de la Ciudad de Pyongyang, Cha Hui Rim, los oficiales y constructores militares participantes en la construccion, los funcionarios, ancianos y empleados del Asilo de Ancianos de Pyongyang y los funcionarios de los organismos del partido, del poder de la capital y de la rama interesada. 
					
					Al hacer uso de la palabra inaugural O Su Yong dijo que el Asilo de Ancianos de Pyongyang es el fruto del amor al pueblo levantado por el PTC de acuerdo con el proposito de los grandes lideres Kim Il Sung y Kim Jong Il. 
					
					Apunto que en este mundo no hay otro pais como la RPDC que tiene el asilo de ancianos tan maravilloso. 
					
					Los ancianos cortaron una cinta de inauguracion y se mudaron en medio de la felicitacion de los funcionarios de la rama correspondiente y del Asilo, asi como los empleados de ahi.
